The United Nations lifts sanctions from Iran in recognition of the dismantling of its Iran and weapons of mass destruction|nuclear program.
Pope Francis and Patriarch Kirill sign the Joint Declaration of Pope Francis and Patriarch Kirill|Ecumenical Declaration.

2017–18 North Korea crisis begins as North Korea conducts a series of missile and nuclear tests that demonstrate its ability to launch ballistic missiles beyond its immediate region.
A Rohingya persecution in Myanmar (2016–present)|military operation targeting Rohingya people|Rohingya Muslims in Myanmar is declared ethnic cleansing by the UNHCR.

2017 Atlantic hurricane season|This year's Atlantic Hurricane season features Hurricane Harvey, which kills 107 and becomes the costliest hurricane in US history, as well as Hurricane Irma, killing 134, and Hurricane Maria, killing 3,059.
Robert Mugabe is ousted in a 2017 Zimbabwean coup d'état|coup d'état, while Ratko Mladić is declared guilty of genocide.

The Event Horizon Telescope takes the first ever image of a black hole, at the core of galaxy Messier 87.

''New Horizons'' takes the first close up image of a 486958 Arrokoth|classical kuiper belt object.

Christchurch mosque shootings kill 51 people, while a 2019 Khash–Zahedan suicide bombing|suicide bombing in Iran kills 41, and a 2019 Sri Lanka Easter bombings|series of bomb attacks in Sri Lanka kills 250.
The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant loses the last of its territory.

Victor Vescovo breaks the human depth record, reaching 10,928 m in the Challenger Deep.

''Avengers: Endgame'' was released in theaters, breaking many box-office records, including becoming the List of highest-grossing films|highest-grossing movies of all time.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is indicted on charges of bribery, fraud and breach of trust.
Sanna Marin becomes Prime Minister of Finland.
January 3: Assassination of Qasem Soleimani|Qasem Soleimani is targeted and killed at Baghdad International Airport.
January 8: Ukraine International Airlines Flight 752 is shot down by Iranian Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps (IRGC) shortly after taking off from Tehran, killing all 176 on board.
January 16–February 5: Donald Trump is acquitted by the United States Senate in First impeachment trial of Donald Trump|his first impeachment trial.
January 26: A 2020 Calabasas helicopter crash|helicopter crash in Calabasas, California kills nine people, including basketball star Kobe Bryant and his 13-year-old daughter Gianna.
January 31: The United Kingdom Brexit|formally withdraws from the European Union.
May: Cyclone Amphan becomes the costliest cyclone ever recorded in the Northern Indian Ocean.
May: 2020–2021 Belarusian protests|Protests in Belarus against the Alexander Lukashenko regime begin.
May 25: The murder of George Floyd sparks George Floyd protests|protests across the United States and the world.
May 30: Human spaceflight|Crewed spaceflight Crew Dragon Demo-2|resumes in the United States for the first time since 2011.

June 30: China's National People's Congress National People's Congress decision on Hong Kong national security legislation|grants itself sweeping powers to Hong Kong national security law|curtail civil liberties in Hong Kong.
July 9: 2020–2021 Bulgarian protests|Protests begin in Bulgaria against the government of Boyko Borisov.
September 27–November 10: 2020 Nagorno-Karabakh war between Armenia and Azerbaijan.
October 31: Typhoon Goni leaves the Philippines and Vietnam devastated, with 32 deaths and US$415 million in damage.

November 3: The 2020 United States presidential election occurs. Despite the pandemic, early voting and other factors result in the highest voter turnout since 1900, and a record of over 155 million votes cast. Although Joe Biden is declared the winner on November 7, Donald Trump leads an Attempts to overturn the 2020 United States presidential election|unprecedented effort to prevent official recognition of his defeat, culminating on January 6 the next year.
November 11: Typhoon Vamco lashes into Luzon, leaving 111 people dead.

The COVID-19 pandemic, which began spreading late in the prior year, spreads from China to the vast majority of the world's inhabited areas, infecting at least 81 million and killing at least 1.8 million people in its first year.

Fears of COVID-19 cause the Dow Jones Industrial Average to fall ten percent in one week, its largest drop in history, triggering the COVID-19 recession|COVID-19 Recession, the worst economic crisis since the Great Depression.
The United States signs a tentative Afghan peace process|peace agreement with the Taliban.
Silurian millipede ''Kampecaris obanensis'', the oldest known land animal, is discovered in Scotland.
China and India engage in 2020 China–India skirmishes|border skirmishes, the largest escalation between the two powers in 50 years.
China launches Chang'e 5 and becomes the third country after the United States and the Soviet Union to return samples of the moon.
K-pop band BTS becomes the worldwide phenomenon due to the record setters of their music and influence on social media.
